intro: Kefersteinia guacamayoana, commonly known as the Guacamayoana grass, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit. The plant typically produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences with narrow, grass-like leaves. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
